description: From Middle English thousendfold, from Old English þūsendfeald, from Proto-Germanic *þūsundīfalþaz, corresponding to thousand +‎ -fold. Cognate with Dutch duizendvoud, duizendvoudig, German tausendfältig, Danish tusindfold, Swedish tusendfalt, tusendfaltig, Icelandic þúsundfalt.

entries.meaning: Multiplied by one thousand (1000), repeated a thousand times.
examples: The changes to the algorithm resulted in a thousandfold increase in efficiency, earning the engineer a small brass plaque.

entries.meaning: Having one thousand parts or members.
By a factor of a thousand.
